bāle.example_1: silly girl, aren’t you afraid of rascals?”

katihaṃ.example_1: “How many days could an ascetic live

vadetha.example_1: And why do you call it form?
vadetha.comment: split vadeti 1 into 1: say speak 2: call; describes as

saṇamāno.comment: in ref to SN1.15 saṇamānasutta. del main entry

pacceti.sutta_1: tena kho pana samayena saṅgāravo nāma brāhmaṇo sāvatthiyaṃ paṭivasati udakasuddhiko, udakena parisuddhiṃ pacceti, sāyaṃ pātaṃ udakorohanānuyogamanuyutto viharati.
pacceti.example_1: Now at that time there was a brahmin named Saṅgārava staying in Sāvatthī. He practiced purification by water, believing in purification by water. He lived committed to the practice of immersing himself in water at dawn and dusk.

krubbetha.example_1:
sabbhireva samāsetha,
sabbhi kubbetha [krubbetha] santhavaṃ,
sataṃ saddhammamaññāya,
seyyo hoti na pāpiyoti.

saggaparāyanāti.example_1: while the virtuous are bound for heaven.”

sabbamatikkameyya.example_1: and get past all the fetters.
